p: Notably, Bacillus spp. are the most predominant endophytic effective species against plant pathogenic fungi, consistent with many published studies [ 60, 61, 62]. This is attributed to the potential of these species to produce diverse active metabolites and different lytic enzymes, such as amylase, protease, and chitinase, which attack the fungal cell wall [ 62, 63]. According to the obtained results, we can conclude that the endophytic strains Bacillus cereus PI-8 and Bacillus subtilis PI-10 exhibited the highest activities, and therefore it could be used as bioinoculants and to examine their effects on Zea maize root growth.
